listing.listing_description:
Sonoma County Transient Occupancy Tax Certificate #1653N.

This extraordinary villa in the Napa and Sonoma region enjoys a secluded location within four miles of Sonoma Plaza. Nestled on 1.7 acres of beautifully landscaped estate with expansive views of the hills, the four-bedroom home is designed in the style of a modern Italian villa, with cypress trees flanking its outdoor pool, terracotta tile floors, and luminous pastel finishes. With a three-bedroom main house and large guesthouse, this vacation rental welcomes families and groups of friends seeking a unique yet quintessential experience of California Wine Country.

Lovers of the open air will feel at home at Villa Casterno. An ample pool and half-moon-shaped spa invite you to soothing dips under the sun and stars, while sun loungers await you beneath the pergola. There is a charming bocce court for afternoon fun, while the expansive terrace welcomes alfresco barbeque meals and nighttime wine tastings around the fire pit.

The 3,000-square-foot main house features three bedrooms upstairs and ample living spaces on the ground floor. Tall French doors infuse the living room with natural light and country breezes, while the fireplace keeps it toasty on cool evenings. A beautiful, peach-toned dining room seats eight beneath an astrolabe chandelier. The kitchen is fully equipped with chef-grade appliances and ample prep space, and easily serves the dining room and alfresco patio. Heating, air conditioning, and a Sonos sound system allow you to customize your atmosphere, and there is a lovely office for quiet work or study.

The master suite boasts a king bed, lounge area with fireplace, private balcony with gorgeous views, and ensuite bathroom with a marble steam shower and tub. Both of the guestrooms have queen beds and share a bathroom between them, and one opens to a balcony as well. The spacious, stand-alone guesthouse includes a studio-style apartment with queen bed, TV lounge, kitchenette, and private balcony, accompanied by a media room with sleeper sofa.

Villa Casterno complements your privacy with outstanding proximity to the treasures of Sonoma wine country. You're minutes from Glen Ellen and Bouverie Wildflower Preserve, and just over four miles from Sonoma Plaza and the Overlook Trail. World-class wineries, restaurants, and tasting rooms abound in this area, and Sonoma Golf Club is close by as well.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Experience true Western hospitality at Golf and Tennis 15. Whether you’re eager to tee off or practice your serve or would prefer to stay in and just admire the Wyoming scenery, you’ll find something to love about this charming cabin-style vacation rental near the town of Jackson. Enjoy its picturesque setting, cozy architecture and three bedrooms with family and friends, or reserve it for a honeymoon close to nature.

In warmer weather, watch the moon rise over the mountains from outdoor areas with a barbecue and firepit. If you’ve come for the skiing, leave gear in the mudroom and unwind by the wood-burning fireplace with the help of the TV and Wi-Fi.

Though it does use plenty of wood and stone for a warm, inviting feel, this cabin-inspired residence is surprisingly modern inside, with floor-to-ceiling windows showcasing views of the Grand Tetons and graceful furnishings filling the sitting and dining areas. An equally wonderful surprise is the fully equipped kitchen and its breakfast bar, stainless steel appliances and granite countertops.

Golf and Tennis 15 has one master bedroom with a king bed and a private en-suite bathroom, and two bedrooms with queen beds and shared access to a hall bathroom, one of which also has a queen sofa bed. The three bedrooms can accommodate groups of up to ten on holiday together.

In addition to comfortable surroundings, a stay at the villa also affords guests the luxury of being close to the best of the outdoor attractions in the area. It’s a 5-minute walk from Golf and Tennis 15 to the Jackson Hole Golf and Tennis Club, less than a 5-mile drive to Grand Teton National Park and less than a 10-mile drive to the shopping, dining and nightlife in the town of Jackson. And in the winter, it’s just under 18 miles to skiing at the Jackson Hole Mountain Resort.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Secluded amid aspen and pine woods near Teton Village, Holly Haus is located just three minutes from Jackson Hole Mountain Resort and about a mile from Shooting Star Golf Club. The modern, chalet-style home offers ample space and resort-like features including an alfresco hot tub and cavernous great room, while its four gorgeous bedrooms include a spacious master suite and a kid-friendly bunk room, accommodating ten guests in all.

The villa's main living areas are located on the upper level. Cathedral windows gaze out from the vaulted great room into the rich forest, while a gorgeous stone hearth with wood-burning fireplace warms the open-concept space. The luminous kitchen features chef-grade appliances and an island bar, and easily serves the dining table and lounge. Glass doors open to the upper-level deck, where a dining table welcomes alfresco feasts on warm summer evenings. The stand-alone spa is located on the patio below, beckoning you to a starlit soak in the crisp, pine-scented air.

Sharing the upper level with the great room, the master suite enjoys high, vaulted ceilings, ample windows, and doors to the deck, while its spacious ensuite bathroom includes dual vanities, a steam shower, and a jetted soaking tub with lovely forest views. On the ground floor, the primary guest suite features a king bed and ensuite bathroom, while the other two rooms—one with queen bed, one with two bunk beds (sleeping four)—share a bathroom between them, forming an ideal family suite. These lower-level rooms open to the patio and hot tub.

Holly Haus offers an extraordinary balance of seclusion and convenience, with a prime location just four minutes from the heart of Teton Village and three minutes from Jackson Hole Mountain Resort. Outstanding hiking trails can be accessed from the property, while the fairways of Shooting Star are just over a mile away.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Belle Epoque French elegance meets contemporary luxury in this newly built Beverly Hills estate. Wrought-iron railings, a stained-glass dome, and inlaid marble floors form the European-inspired setting for a state-of-the-art home theater and professional-grade appliances like a La Cornue range. This wood-paneled haven, however, is only a 5-minute drive from the big-name boutiques of Rodeo Drive.

 Along with nearly 12,000 square feet of living space, this vacation rental boasts outdoor living areas with a heated pool, hot tub, an al-fresco kitchen with a barbecue, loungers in the California sun, and a shaded sitting area. Inside, the amenities range from a home theater and wine cellar to a beautifully paneled home office, satellite TV, and Wi-Fi.

 Double doors open to a double-height foyer whose sweeping wrought-iron staircase draws the eye up to the stained-glass cupola. There are formal living and dining areas just off the entry, or you can follow the arched hallway to a family room and a fully equipped kitchen with a breakfast bar and a dining nook. High ceilings throughout add a sense of spaciousness, while wood and marble floors are luxe underfoot.

 The estate has three bedrooms with king beds and private en-suite bathrooms, as well as a fourth king bedroom that shares a bathroom with a bedroom with two twin beds. Two staff rooms, each with a double bed and shared bathroom, mean there’s flexibility for larger groups on holiday together.

 Haute Beverly is only a 5-minute drive from the haute couture of Rodeo Drive, and 10 miles or less from local must-sees such as the Los Angeles County Museum of Art, the Getty Center, Griffith Observatory, and Universal Studios. Hike through Runyon Canyon Park or relive your honeymoon on a sunset stroll along the beach in Santa Monica or Venice.

 Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
This magnificent chalet is situated within the Moonlight Basin enclave at Big Sky Resort in Montana, with ski-in/ski-out access to Cinnabar Run. Perched on a hillside with panoramic mountain views, the chalet is perfectly designed for savoring the open-air delights and cozy pleasures of Montana. High-end amenities include an outdoor hot tub, alfresco lounge and dining area, a gourmet kitchen, and a well-equipped game room. Four spacious bedroom suites plus two kid-friendly bunkrooms accommodate families and groups of friends up to twenty in size. At extra cost, guests can enjoy access to Moonlight Basin Clubhouse, including its Jack Nicklaus Signature golf course.

The main living room offers a quintessential setting for après-ski relaxation, with double-height ceilings, a beautiful stone hearth, fine timber beams, and ample windows gazing out on breathtaking vistas. The dining table seats eight on lovely leather chairs, and the open kitchen features chef-quality appliances, a generous island with extensive breakfast bar, and a lounge area in a luminous nook.

The covered deck features high, peaked ceilings and a wonderful outdoor fireplace, forming a comfortable setting in any season. Downstairs, the mountain-view family room includes a wet bar, TV lounge, fireplace, and tables for foosball and pool. A separate media room includes a large flat-screen TV and another wet bar, and there is also a home office.

The master bedroom is on the main level, with a four-poster king bed, panoramic mountain views, and a large fireplace. Its beautiful ensuite bathroom includes a dual vanity, walk-in shower, and a soaking tub perched beneath an antler chandelier. The primary guest suite is upstairs, featuring a king bed, extraordinary views, a fireplace, and an ensuite bathroom with shower and tub. The upstairs bunkrooms accommodate up to eight children. The bottom floor includes two suites: one with a king bed, one with a pair of double beds.

The villa has a two-car garage and a ski rom with lockers and boot dyers. You can ski directly on and off the intermediate-friendly Cinnabar Run (the ski-out section is also beginner-friendly), and Powder Run is just a short walk away. Nearby Moonlight Basin Clubhouse features a fitness center, outdoor pool, and extraordinary outdoor sporting opportunities.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Water splashes over the side of the infinity pool and burbles in a courtyard fountain at this custom-built residence close to downtown Austin. Glass walls offer up panoramas of Texas hill country, and carved wooden pieces bring craftsmanship from around the globe inside. Drive 11 miles to downtown for a free tour of the state capitol building or an evening out amid bungalows turned bars. 

Let your eyes wander over the wide-open spaces from outdoor living areas with a swimming pool, barbecue, and loungers; get cozy around the firepit in the private courtyard; and drape a blanket over a shady patch of the grounds for a nature-centered yoga practice. Entertain friends and family from the wet bar and smart TVs or take a moment for yourself with the help of the gas fireplace and Wi-Fi. 

This custom vacation rental is perfectly suited to its site, with glass walls neatly framing green hills and blue sky in the living and dining rooms. In the fully equipped kitchen, you’ll find windows over the sink instead of upper cabinets. Richly patterned area rugs and an eclectic mix of furnishings, from the farmhouse-inspired to contemporary, add personality throughout. 

There are 2 bedrooms in the main house of this luxury property, 1 in an annex, and 1 in a separate casita; all 4 bedrooms have ensuite bathrooms. The main house has 1 king bedroom and 1 queen bedroom, and the annex has a queen bed. The casita has a queen bed as well as a kitchenette and living area, making it ideal for in-laws on holiday with the rest of the family or a couple wanting a honeymoon-style escape.

The villa is less than a 10-minute drive from 2 golf courses and less than a 10-mile drive from Zilker Park, where you’ll find the 3-acre limestone-traced expanse of Barton Springs Pool. It’s 11 miles to downtown Austin, where you can tour the state capitol and museums by day, and sample cocktails, barbecue, and more by night. 

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
With a sprawling backyard, mountain views and a location close to some of the area’s best golf courses, Strut Oasis - 70 truly lives up to its name. This Desert Cities retreat has incredible amenities and stylish open-plan interiors, making it perfect for a warm-weather holiday with family or golf getaway with friends. Reserve this six-bedroom vacation rental for groups of up to a dozen, or book its sister property, Strut Oasis - 71, for larger parties.

Whether you prefer the California sunshine or the cool of the shade, the villa’s expansive outdoor living areas can accommodate. Stretch out on one of the loungers or hammocks by the pool and hot tub, challenge friends to a game of croquet on the lawn or practice your spike on the sand volleyball court. For those who picked shade, there are covered sitting and dining areas. As night falls, heat up the barbecue in the outdoor kitchen, gather around the firepit or head inside to enjoy the sound system, satellite TV and Wi-Fi.

The interiors mix modern and traditional pieces with ease for a look of eclectic luxury. In the sitting area, mod lounge chairs square off against tufted leather sofas, while the dining area seats twelve in quilted leather chairs. An open-concept great room that includes the sitting and dining areas and a fully equipped kitchen encourages guests to mingle.

Strut Oasis - 70 has three bedrooms with king beds and en-suite bathrooms, including a honeymoon-suite-style master with a jetted tub, fireplace and terrace access, and one bedroom with its own private entrance. There’s also a king bedroom with a hall bathroom and a pair of bedrooms with king and queen beds, respectively, that share a bathroom. If you’re traveling with kids, they’ll love having their own space: a private room with two bunk beds.

The villa is convenient for avid golfers, festival devotees, tennis buffs and shopping fiends alike; there are five golf clubs within a 10-mile drive, the Coachella grounds are 10 minutes away, and Indian Wells and Old Town La Quinta are both nearby. For more shopping and dining options, make the 5-minute drive into downtown Indio. Architecture fans will want to make a day trip to take in the mid-century style of Palm Springs; for equally incredible natural landscapes, head for Joshua Tree National Park.

City ID # 19-00023265

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Lush landscaping and an acre of land alongside encompassing verdant greenery gives this property a feeling of complete serenity. One room seamlessly flows into the next with plush furniture and intricate area rugs sitting atop polished hardwood floors. This summer escape is close to historic sights and shopping in Southampton Village as well as stretching shorelines at pristine Cooper’s Beach.

Modern details blend with old-fashioned charm. Towering ceilings allow room for an abundance of windows, soaking the living space with soft, natural light. A sweeping staircase leads to the library—pick a book from the generously lined shelves before settling onto the plump couch. Afterwards, curl up on the lavish magenta sectional in the media room and get lost in a favourite family flick. French doors open out to the peaceful yard. In the evenings, a roaring fireplace under the sheltered patio is a cozy spot to enjoy a bottle of Pinot Noir.

Treat yourself (and the gourmet kitchen) to the luxury of a private chef for a taste of fresh fare at each meal—served in the elegant dining room or casual eatery. Nearby Sag Harbour is home to a variety of waterfront restaurants offering everything from raw oysters to chilled rosé. Work up a sweat in your fully equipped gym before cooling off in the saltwater swimming pool. Shinnecock Hills Golf Club, Little Plains Beach, and Flying Point Beach are a short drive away as well as wineries, museums, and galleries in Bridgehampton.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Stay close to the Coachella grounds, several golf courses and downtown Indio at Strut Oasis - 71. With an expansive backyard and well-appointed outdoor living areas, this Desert Cities vacation rental lives up to the “oasis” in its name. Book this five-bedroom property for a holiday with up to twelve friends and family members; for larger parties, reserve its sister property, Strut Oasis - 70, as well.

Soak in the California sunshine from a lounger or hammock by the pool, play a game of croquet or practice cartwheels on the lawn, and serve up meals fresh from the barbecue at the al-fresco dining area. Of course, it’s just as easy to entertain or relax indoors, where you’ll find a pool table, Sonos sound system, satellite TV, Wi-Fi and a wine cooler.

The interiors of Strut Oasis - 71 are comfortable and modern—but with a glamorous edge that’s a reminder of the mid-century days when the Desert Cities were both honeymoon destination and hideaway for Hollywood celebrities. The open-plan great room, with sitting and dining areas and a fully equipped kitchen, offers the luxury of plenty of space for everyone to gather. Pieces like tufted royal-blue sofas, brass stools at the breakfast bar and Eames molded dining armchairs add individual chic to each space within the room.

The villa’s master suite is its own private oasis with a king bed, en-suite bathroom with jetted tub and walk-in closet. There are three other bedrooms with king beds—one with a hall bathroom, and two that share a hall bathroom—and one bedroom with two bunk beds and an en-suite bathroom. For larger parties, there are three other rooms with two queen beds and a king bed.

With several golf clubs, the Coachella festival grounds, downtown Indio and Old Town La Quinta all within a 10-minute drive, you can easily spend a day teeing off, watching a world-class performer, exploring shops and restaurants, or browsing boutiques in a charming ambience. Architecture buffs won’t want to miss the mid-century modern masterpieces in nearby Palm Springs, while fans of more natural works of art will want to hike through the unforgettable scenery in Joshua Tree National Park.

City ID # 20-00023266

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Feel the love as you enter this stately traditional colonial family home. From the ornate marble fireplace to the backyard pool and spa, it’s a beautiful, comfortable place to kick off your boots and stay awhile. Designated as an Austin landmark, a plaque pays tribute to the original owners of the home. Welcoming trees spread their shade over a manicured lawn and backyard deck area, where a charcuterie tray and Italian red are an excellent accompaniment to relaxing poolside.

Austin is such a hip and happening city; there are always exciting things to do for the whole family. And Landmark Estate is the perfect starting point. Have Guest Experience arrange pre-stocking of the fridge and bar, or a chef to prepare dinner later, get ready to discover Austin.

First, do some hipster-gazing while dosing on caffeine. If it’s game day, witness the burnt-orange madness of a University of Texas home football game. Speaking of games, pinball arcades here are legendary--lunch from the many food trucks. Checkout the yarn-bombed trees, visit the Umlauf Sculpture garden. Top off the day with a round of mini-golf; all driveable in and around Austin. This itinerary will totally make your kids think you’re cool.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Enjoy the pristine surroundings of Los Angeles’ only oceanside resort. Terranea Retreat is one of the few three-bedroom villas on this vast 102 acre property that features front row views of both verdant fairways and the Pacific Ocean. The villa was only recently built, in 2008, and houses a wealth of high-end amenities, with access to countless five-star shared facilities.

Terranea Retreat seamlessly blends indoor and outdoor living, and nearly every room opens to spacious exterior areas. The entry courtyard is loaded with charm and its cozy furniture surrounds a lovely outdoor fireplace. The lanai has a shaded table and hot tub, both ideal places to relax and enjoy stunning panoramic views and sunsets. A walk around the resort will reveal all the shared amenities available to you: swimming pools, a fitness center, an award-winning spa, restaurants, cafés, hiking trails and more.

Beautiful arched windows throw light on the elegant contemporary interior. Vaulted beam ceilings and hardwood floors create a sense of warmth while the great room’s modern furnishings contribute to an ambiance of sophistication. You’ll love getting creative in the chef’s kitchen on state of the art appliances and smooth natural stone surfaces. After a long day, ease into a comfortable living room sofa and watch a movie on the flatscreen, as flames dance in the fireplace below.

The Master bedroom features a King bed that looks out to the ocean. This expansive suite houses a separate dressing room, desk and a spa-inspired en-suite with dual vanities, bathtub and shower. The second bedroom has two Queen size beds, while the remaining room has a King size bed and each holds its own well-appointed en-suite. All bedrooms are air conditioned and include a television.

Terranea Resort is nestled upon a slice of paradise called Rancho Palos Verdes Peninsula, just South of Los Angeles. It’s a quick hike to the iconic Point Vicente Lighthouse and there are plenty of picturesque spots to discover nearby. The property is a great jumping off point for day trips into the city, while the beaches and attractive seaside towns of Orange County are close by.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Thoughtful modern design and a convenient slope-side location make Dwell on Woodside an easy choice for a relaxed ski holiday. Set on a ski run and just steps from Park City’s charming downtown, this luxury vacation rental couldn’t make it simpler to spend your days on the trails and your evenings exploring the area.

You’ll want to spend most of your stay skiing, hiking or otherwise enjoying Utah’s incredible natural scenery. But when you return to Dwell on Woodside, step onto the private balcony for a soak in the hot tub or to prep dinner on the barbecue. Inside, you can relax in front of the fireplace with a selection from the wine fridge or share snaps of your trip over the house’s Wi-Fi.

The villa’s interiors are an intriguing mix of old and new, traditional and contemporary. Though the beamed, vaulted ceilings, stone mantel and iron chandelier of the living room bring to mind stately European estates, the plush sofas, playful beanbag chair and colorful glass art have a more relaxed feel. Slipcovered chairs seat up to eight at the dining table, and drafting stools offer four more perches—and a great view of the artwork—at the breakfast bar in the fully equipped kitchen.

If you’ve come out West for the skiing, you’ll appreciate the walk-in/walk-out access to Park City Mountain Resort and the 5-minute drive to Deer Valley Resort. You’re also just a short walk from downtown Park City, which has everything from the playful Park Silly Sunday Market and quaint historic architecture to honeymoon-worthy restaurants and lively nightlife. Other local sights include the Swaner Preserve and EcoCenter and Utah Olympic Park, and if it’s not a true getaway without golf, you’ll find a course just 2.5 miles away. When it’s time to leave, stop in to see the up-and-coming scene in downtown Salt Lake City on your way to the airport there.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Sunsets glow over neighboring fields and wash over the double-infinity pool at this glass-walled Amagansett retreat. The warm light floods interiors clad in cedar, white oak, and teak cabinetry, bringing natural beauty into sleek spaces designed by award-winning architect Andrew Pollock. Walk to Amagansett Village, where seafood spots sit next to designer pop-ups, and drive 2 miles to the beach.

This vacation rental sits on 1.4 private acres lined with mature trees and opening to a lush field—a quiet setting for you to lounge by a swimming pool with a double infinity edge, toss local seafood on the barbecue, and uncork N.Y. wines at the al-fresco dining table. Inside, you’ll find a cable TV, Sonos sound system, and Wi-Fi.

Glass walls divide the villa’s wooded setting from the wood-paneled interiors. Cedar walls line the L-shaped living room, fully equipped kitchen, and dining room, while wide-plank white-oak floors stretch out underfoot. The kitchen’s custom teak cabinets are topped with subtly textured Pietra Cardosa stone. Catch up on reading in the Eames lounger in the separate den.

This luxury property has five bedrooms with en-suite bathrooms: one master with a king bed, two with queen beds, one with a double bed, and one with two twin beds. The other two bedrooms have double beds and share access to a hall bathroom. Together, the bedrooms can accommodate groups of up to 14 friends or family members on a Hamptons holiday.

Walk from the villa to downtown Amagansett for a summer treat from a designer boutique or a honeymoon-worthy dinner of fresh seafood. It’s a 2-mile drive from the house to lifeguard-protected Atlantic Avenue Beach, where you can rent umbrellas, chairs, and beach toys, and grab clam rolls, salads, snacks, and more from the Beach Hut.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Just steps from Park City’s Historic Main Street, Mountain Getaway has a prime location for enjoying all that this iconic mountain town has to offer. Within seven minutes drive, you’ll have access to Park City and Deer Valley Resort bases, as well as several other ski access points. You’ll also find Park Silly Sunday Market, golf, skating, and hiking nearby. And, Salt Lake City is less than an hour’s drive from Mountain Escape.

Mountain Escape’s open concept great room is the perfect place to gather as a group, get a fire going, and recount tales of everyone’s exciting day skiing. Plush designer furniture, featuring more than enough space for everyone, is positioned around the flat screen television and wood burning stone fireplace. In the kitchen, dining area, and lounge you’ll find decor leaning more towards a modern-contemporary vibe, as well as high-end electronics and state of the art appliances.

Fresh mountain air and soaring mountain views are easy to find on the lavishly outfitted two-story terrace. Perfect for an alfresco dinner, Mountain Escape’s terrace features a barbecue and smoker. And, the fire pit is great for whipping up some s’mores and marshmallows for dessert. Another essential feature of the terrace is the hot tub; you’ll love it after a long day on the mountain. Back inside, Mountain Escape’s fully equipped kitchen features a dishwasher, breakfast bar, and there’s formal dining with space for eight. And, tech features include Wi-Fi, a streaming TV, and a Sonos sound system.

While you’re in Park City, you’ll have numerous options for dinner, drinks, and nightlife on Historic Main Street. In the mornings, head into town for breakfast before you hit the slopes at one of Main Street’s many independent cafes. Try out the newest ski gear in the boutique shops. For the craft beer aficionados, Wasatch Brew Pub has plenty of award-winning creations to sample. And, if you feel like dancing or watching live music, check the monthly listings at the Egyptian Theatre and Park City Live, both feature a diverse range of entertainment.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.
